history.content: Unless you have previous teaching experience, I don't think it works that way ("I always heard that if you do well in an upper division course, the next semester you can TA for it"). Usually the pathway is to first become a reader for the course and then a TA in the subsequent semester (if you perform well as a reader).

children.subject: Would the same reason that keeps me from being considered as a TA not keep me from being a reader? My races won’t be out in time.

no, you can realistically become a reader the semester directly after taking a class. i believe it's usually helpful if you're doing well in the class when applying, and have prior teaching experience, and/or talk to the staff about your interest. (source: personal experience)

The reason they want you to be a reader before being a TA is not your grades; its because they want you to get at least 2 passes through the material, see how you fare and it is also for you to gain enough mastery of the material before you actually teach students (which I believe is very essential). Of course this does not apply to every course so talking to the current course staff expressing your interest would definitely help, but the general pathway I mentioned is true for most CS classes where a large number of people apply to be TAs,
Can you become a reader the subsequent semester?

It is possible to get a TA/GSI position the semester after taking a course. (In my experience) the professor extends an informal offer which isn't formalized until grades come in. 

This being said, it's unlikely that you would see this happen in 170/188, since they're such massive classes, and there are so many people with semesters of 170 teaching experience who are also vying for TA/GSI positions. Professors are probably also less willing to deal with waiting on grades when there are more people whose grades are long in.

history.content:
I always heard that if you do well in an upper division course, the next semester you can TA for it. However, I’m also hearing that I can’t get approved for a TA position until after my grades come out, which is too late to be chosen for a TA position for the next semester.

So, if I take two courses, say CS170 and CS188, and am enjoying the course/on track to do well, is it possible to TA for them the following semester, or no?
history.subject: Confusion Over Teaching Options
